docs.snippet: A copy of the following communication was handed in at the office of the City Inspector, where it was mislaid, without his inspection. He expressed the opinion, however, that the subject did not come under his jurisdiction. I respectfully offer my...
docs.lead_paragraph: A copy of the following communication was handed in at the office of the City Inspector, where it was mislaid, without his inspection. He expressed the opinion, however, that the subject did not come under his jurisdiction. I respectfully offer my humble suggestions for the scrutiny of the public, of the Medical Faculty, and of the Bond of Health of this City. I remark that Disinfection is recommended for ...

headline.main: THE DISUNION MOVEMENT.; Slavery the Basis of the New Confederacy. ITS POSITION AND PROSPECTS. Speech of Hon. A.H. Stephens, Vice-President of the Confederate States. Delivered at Savannah, March 21, 1861.

docs.snippet: The bill passed by the Senate to amend the act relative to inland navigation insurance, allowing all companies to insure lake and river risks, was reported complete, and, by consent, read a third time and passed.
docs.lead_paragraph: The bill passed by the Senate to amend the act relative to inland navigation insurance, allowing all companies to insure lake and river risks, was reported complete, and, by consent, read a third time and passed.

headline.main: OUR WASHINGTON CORRESPONDENCE.; COL. COOPER, LATE ADJUTANT-GENERAL SENATOR MASON STATE OF AFFAIRS IN TENNESSEE THE SOUTHERN FLAG, ETC.

docs.lead_paragraph: It seems that Mr. MASON'S brother-in-law, Col. COOPER, who resigned the office of AdjutantGeneral of the United States, has received the appointment to the corresponding position at Montgomery. At the time of his resignation, his friends stated that he was induced to take the step from his knowledge of the war like policy which would be pursued by the Federal authorities.

docs.snippet: The Assembly presents a fuller aspect than yesterday, but there are yet a number of vacant seats, and if the present system of granting indefinite leaves of absence is continued, there will not be a full house this session.

headline.main: FROM THE STATE CAPITAL.; Swill Milk Rapid Dispatch of Business Legal Status of Resident Aliens Constitutional Reform State Roads and Inroads in the North Woods Metropolitan Health Bill New-York Loaner's Association Harlem River Improvement.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Assembly presents a fuller aspect than yesterday, but there are yet a number of vacant seats, and if the present system of granting indefinite leaves of absence is continued, there will not be a full house this session.

headline.main: THE FLORENCE NIGHTINGALE OF THE NURSERY.; The following is an extract from a letter written by Rev C.Z. Weiser, to the "German, Reformed Messenger," at Chambersburgh, Penn. A BENEFACTRESS.
